title: 3 Critical Factors to Research for Amazon KDP Using Publisher Rocket | Deep Dive Publishers

tactics.name: Keyword Research
tactics.description: Identify relevant keywords for discoverability by analyzing Kindle-only searches and top-performing books in your niche.
steps: Analyze top 10 books in your category
caveats: Keyword research may fail if niche is too broad
source_quotes: people type in certain things and the algorithm gives them stuff that matches

tactics.name: Category Optimization
tactics.description: Ensure accurate categorization to align with Amazon's requirements and target the right audience.
steps: Validate category accuracy against book content
source_quotes: Amazon does not consider the physical copy of the book and the digital copy of the book as the same book

tactics.name: bundle_discount_tactic
tactics.description: Promote self-publishing bundle with discounted price via Publisher Rocket
steps: Direct viewers to purchase bundle at discounted rate
source_quotes: we would sell it for 497 dollars but lucky you you'll get it for 97

heuristics.name: Top Seller Analysis
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews is less than 200, then boost the book's visibility
source_quotes: study those books and see why that book is doing well

heuristics.name: review_threshold_heuristic

claims.statement: Amazon treats Kindle and physical book editions as separate entities with distinct rankings and values.
source_quotes: Amazon does not consider the physical copy of the book and the digital copy of the book as the same book

claims.statement: Publisher Rocket helps identify profitable niches with low review counts
source_quotes: we would sell it for 497 dollars but lucky you you'll get it for 97

niche_patterns.description: Target specific audience segments with clear identity, problem, and constraint parameters.
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Niche alignment improves discoverability and relevance for targeted buyers.
source_quotes: you want people who are searching those categories to be the people who would enjoy reading your book
